result_list.explanation: Il va pour sortir. (He is about to exit.) This stage direction indicates a character exiting.
À Léontine. (To Léontine.) This stage direction indicates the addressee of a speech.
Air : J'ai fait souvent résonner ma Musette. (Tune: I often made my Musette resound.) This stage direction describes a tune name and is related to music.
result_list.stgdir: Air : J'ai fait souvent résonner ma Musette.

result_list.explanation: Il remonte un peu. (He moves up a bit.) This stage direction describes character movement.
Un jardin. (A garden.) This stage direction describes the setting or location.
Au caporal. (To the corporal.) This stage direction indicates the addressee of a speech.
Il s'aperçoit qu' il a déchiré ses billets. (He realizes he has torn his tickets.) This stage direction describes the character's interaction with an object.
result_list.stgdir: Il s'aperçoit qu' il a déchiré ses billets.

result_list.explanation: Cherchant. (Searching.) This stage direction describes a general character action.

Sortant du pavillon de gauche, et se dirigeant vers la droite, tandis que Courtès va du côte contraire. (Exiting the left pavilion and moving to the right, while Courtès goes the opposite way.) This stage direction describes character movement.
result_list.stgdir: Sortant du pavillon de gauche, et se dirigeant vers la droite, tandis que Courtès va du côte contraire.

result_list.explanation: À la cour ; un jardin. (At the court; a garden.) This stage direction describes the setting or location.
